evidence: Ankaufsuntersuchung (AKU) - acronym used correctly, explained as 'externe klinische Untersuchung'
Equidenpass - explained purpose and requirements (Impfhistorie, Behandlungs-Logbuch)
OCD (Osteochondritis Dissecans) - explained as 'Knorpelerkrankung durch zu schnelles Wachstum', cost implications (€1,500-€3,000+)
ERU (equine recurrent uveitis) - described as 'Augentränfluss or Augen-Schwellungen', chronic and expensive
EMAD (Equine Multiocular Autoimmune Disease) - mentioned with breed-specificity
BGB §474-482 - Kaufrecht für Verbraucher correctly cited
FN (Fachverband, Deutsche Reiterliche Vereinigung) - referenced as authority for breed standards
expertise_scoring_breakdown.assessment: EXCELLENT - Mastery demonstrated through 7+ technical terms, all explained in context with implications

evidence: Market structure understanding (ehorses dominance, pferde.de filter quality, Kleinanzeigen for private sellers)

expertise_scoring_breakdown.assessment: EXCELLENT - Demonstrates professional-level knowledge across pricing, markets, health, law, and finance

2025 pricing current as of publication date

trustworthiness_dimension.interpretation: Good - Statistical claims supported with sources, risks acknowledged, balanced pros/cons. Could strengthen with more transparency about data sources.

1,600+ ehorses inserate - specific current count cited

'Seien Sie ehrlich mit sich selbst' regarding budget

trustworthiness_scoring_breakdown.criterion: Balanced Pros & Cons / Before-After Perspective (Max 0.5 points)

strengths: Exceptional experience signals: 30+ specific prices, costs, timelines
Deep expertise: 10+ technical terms correctly explained with implications
Strong authoritativeness: 7+ official references (FN, EU law, veterinary standards), December 2024 market data

Strong content hook: Problem-promise-credibility anchor in first 100 words
improvement_areas: Author credentials not visible in markdown (implement in publication metadata)
Fraud/scam prevention could be expanded beyond current 6 red flags
Could explicitly state 'Research based on ehorses December 2024 market analysis' upfront
Some technical terms (ERU, OCD) explained but could link to veterinary sources

publication_recommendations_eeat.recommendation: Add author credentials/bio on publication page. Example: 'Written by [Name], Equestrian Professional with 15+ years of horse buying/breeding experience. Certified in horse health and contract law.'

Add 'Research Methodology' section or callout: 'This guide is based on market analysis from ehorses.de and pferde.de (December 2024), interviews with veterinarians specializing in foal health, and BGB legal framework for animal purchase.'
Add 2-3 external links to official sources: FN-Stutbuch (fn-online.de), German Veterinary Association (tieraerztekammer.de), Equidenpass requirements (equidenpass.eu)

Expand 'Rote Flaggen' section with dedicated fraud/scam section: '5 Common Foal Buying Scams to Avoid' - covers PayPal-only sales, stolen photos, price too good to be true, telegram/whatsapp-only contact, urgent pressure tactics.
